message: How to fix "Namespace prefix 'xsd' is not defined." error in SharePoint 2010
story: Ahmed Magdy shared Development Village's photo to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Development Village
description:
Microsoft SharePoint 2010: If you got "Namespace prefix 'xsd' is not defined." error as in the image so to fix this:

1) Set your browser to use IE8 standards - you can do this by using F12 to get the IE developer tools panel and setting Document Mode to IE8 standards in the developer tools menu/ribbon thing.

2) Add the meta tag: <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=8"/> to your master page. This will force the browser to use IE8 Standards.

Unfortunately you lose the benefit of the IE9 rendering engine which why it might be preferable to use the first method as and when required, rather than forcing all IE9 users to effectively downgrade to view your pages.

Ref: http://www.spdoctor.net/Pages/message.aspx?name=namespace-prefix-xsd-is-not-defined
